alert.note: Alert for Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 01 at 1:51PM MDT until November 02 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 9 PM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR NORTHEAST WYOMING AND WESTERN SOUTH DAKOTA... .Strong gusty southwest winds coupled with very dry air and warm temperatures will continue to bring a long duration of critical fire weather conditions through Wednesday evening. The strongest winds are expected over northeast Wyoming into far western SD, where gusts over 50 mph are likely. Minimum afternoon relative humidities will drop into the teens with poor recovery tonight, especially on the eastern slopes of the Black Hills. A cold front will move into the region Wednesday evening. Gusty northwest winds and increasing relative humidities are expected behind it, along with chances for snow. The best chances for accumulating snow will be over northeast Wyoming, the northern Black Hills, and near the Nebraska border. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 318, 319, AND 320... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 318 Wyoming Black Hills, 319 Northern Black Hills and 320 Central Black Hills. * WINDS...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. Gusts up to 60 mph on the north and northeast slopes of the Black Hills late tonight and Wednesday morning. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity will produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills
